intro: Emmenospermum parishii, commonly known as the Chinese emmenospermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with lance-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically orange-red in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display. Emmenospermum parishii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
